intro: Ageratina corylifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf ageratum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, clustered flower heads. The plant features palmately lobed leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive, heart-shaped appearance. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that are typically arranged in dense inflorescences. Ageratina corylifolia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
